I'm straight now! I haven't talked about this stuff in years so its a littl=
e hazy working off memory. 
=C2=A0
Also, never trust Wiki as an academic re=
source. ;)
=C2=A0
Frank R.

oo.com> wrote:

Subject: Re: [EVP=

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 3:3=
1 PM











This might clear a few misconceptions up. =C2=A0 It is a ve=
ry broad spectrum and includes radio waves.
=C2=A0
http://en.wikipedia .org=
/wiki/ Electromagnetic_ spectrum
=C2=A0"Nature is showing us only the tail =
of the lion, but I have no doubt that the lion belongs to it even though, b=
ecause of its large size, it cannot totally reveal itself all at once." 
-=
=E2=80=94 Albert Einstein 



"It is far better to grasp the universe as it=
 really is than to persist in delusions, however satisfying and reassuring.=
"
--Carl Sagan


"There is no such thing as an insignificant detail. Don't =
just look 
for what you want to find."
-- Me LOL 






From: April Abercro=
mbie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Se=
nt: Monday, June 8, 2009 3:21:23 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas




Th=
is seems to jive with what I have learned this far, but I am still not cert=
ain I understand it completely.
=C2=A0
I thought everything was based in th=
e electromagnetic spectrum.
=C2=A0
----- Original Message ----- 

From: Fra=
nk Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:05 PM=

Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








Tell me where the seperation on t=
he spectrum takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, soundwaves cause pre=
ssure waves that our ears read as vibration and our mind translates as soun=
d. The waves are still on the electromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic geoma=
gnetic waves are present on the scale. What I mean by power can be directll=
 translated to volume or amplitude. The only thing that distinguishes sound=
waves from any other wave is the fact that we can hear them.
=C2=A0
Frank R=
.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer=
@yahoo. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
=
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:53 PM








No. Sounds waves are not on the=
 electromagnet spectrum nor are they a form of electromagnet energy. Sound =
waves are based on pressure waves in the air (or in other substances).=C2=
=A0 Our ears detect these pressure waves and translate them into sounds we =
here.=C2=A0 Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet energy.=C2=A0 Our eyes do: th=
at part which we call visible light.



--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <wa=
rrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:


From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>=

Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday=
, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM









It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ..=
..."
=C2=A0
A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking that there are =
two different types of energy at work when it comes to sound waves and elec=
tromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is frequency and powe=
r. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain block of the e=
lectromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just fart=
her down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penetrat=
e almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelength =
the more ways we can shield against them.
=C2=A0
Think of microwaves. These=
 are also a type of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but the waves als=
o have a physical effect on our environment by causing molecules to speed u=
p, which creates heat. A little lower than this is IR or infrared it too ca=
n cause physical objects to heat up but usually it just causes molecules to=
 rotate in place. All physical things give off IR light. Its a way the tota=
l system conserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.
=C2=A0
Fr=
ank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresea=
rch. com> wrote:


From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch=
. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments]
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM





Here is some food for th=
ought. I am currently reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.
=
=C2=A0
It was me and another girl teammate=C2=A0present in the room. I pick=
ed up a 3rd female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with me.=
 We were standing right next to another digital video recorder that I leave=
 beside my night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voic=
e. I have asked the girl that was with me to check her recording to see if =
she picked it up.
=C2=A0
I have long felt the true EVP does not come from s=
ound waves in the environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodie=
d voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.
=C2=A0
Thi=
s instance with the recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder =
should have picked that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.=

=C2=A0
I am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. The=C2=A0file that is na=
med=C2=A0"01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip.=C2=A0You will hear my voice as I=
 say "Yeah", and then another comes in right after that. I think I know wha=
t it says.
=C2=A0
Again, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did not =
hear this until playback. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it a=
s my one's from the last investigation.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0

----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, Ju=
ne 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








I have a runni=
ng theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly=
 where they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If =
you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if y=
ou add or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or alternate freq=
uency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an=
 electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you =
will have a intermediate difference=C2=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within hum=
an hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electro=
nic equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From th=
is theory I always felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of the =
recorder.
=C2=A0
We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radio wit=
h superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some pass=
ive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Jos=
eph Pompeii.
=C2=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gma=
il. com> wrote:


From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:=
56 PM





Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are often=C2=A0not =
recorded by the microphone but somehow make their way in at the actual=C2=
=A0point where the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or digital.=
=C2=A0

So much we don't know ...
=C2=A0
Zack

=C2=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 a=
t 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:
=









I monitor my audio live. The funny thing is that even so, those la=
st EVP's I captured I did not hear either in the environment, or on my reco=
rding as it happened. I only heard them upon playback.
=C2=A0


----- Origi=
nal Message ----- 
From: Zack Widup 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 



Sent=
: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas




I am =
curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten =
any EVP in real time.
=C2=A0
I=C2=A0took part in=C2=A0an investigation of A=
shmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video camera=
s set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all=C2=A0was bei=
ng monitored and recorded=C2=A0at a central location. Alas, we did not have=
 microphones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder=
 what we might have heard if we did?
=C2=A0
Zack

=C2=A0

<DIV>I have a running theory tha=
t EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they w=
ant it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two u=
ltrasonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if you add or sub=
tract them together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For ex=
ample, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan=
 in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a i=
ntermediate difference frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing ra=
nge (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment=
 generates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I a=
lways felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of the recorder.</DI=
V>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We are able to reproduce this affect in not only =
radio with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in =
some passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" b=
y Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>

<DIV>
<DIV>I am curious if anyone with a microph=
one wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.</DIV>
<DIV=
> </DIV>
<DIV>I took part in an investigation of Ashmore Est=
ates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras set up i=
n the three halls of the building. The video for all was being monitor=
ed and recorded at a central location. Alas, we did not have microphon=
es at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder what we m=
ight have heard if we did?</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Zack</DIV>
